abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Community Development
            Project for Madagascar were as follows: outcomes were
            satisfactory, the risk to development outcome was moderate,
            Bank performance was satisfactory, and Borrower performance
            was also satisfactory. Some lessons learned included: 1) a
            social fund is a very efficient mechanism to build the
            capacity of communities; 2) benefits of social funds will be
            considerably increased if their design allows them to be
            innovative and flexible in order to adapt to changing
            country circumstances and meet urgent needs; 3) it is in the
            interest of development partners such as the World Bank to
            continue to support well-performing and flexible social
            funds as they can be an efficient mechanism to finance, at
            short notice, responses to emergencies or additional
            activities to benefit vulnerable groups, including
            cash-for-work programs and other kinds of cash transfers; 4)
            compliance with national sector policy and strategy, as well
            as strong coordination with sector ministries, lead to
            better synergy and improvement of quality of investment and
            better sustainability of infrastructure built; and 5) demand
            driven programs can run the risk that the most able
            communities will fare the best, and social funds need to
            find ways of working effectively with the most vulnerable communities.

repnme.cdata!:
Madagascar - Community Development Project
            : additional financing

abstracts.cdata!:
This second additional credit for the
            Madagascar for the Community Development Project will
            finance the costs associated with the scaling-up of the
            activities implemented by the social investment fund (Fonds
            d'Intervention pour le Developpment or FID), and
            supported by the project. To a lesser extent, the additional
            credit would also allow for the completion of the
            reconstruction of infrastructure damaged during the 2004
            cyclones. The projects objective remains to improve the use
            of and satisfaction with project-supported social and
            economic services provided amongst participating rural and
            urban communities.

abstracts.cdata!:
The Community Development Project will
            improve project-supported social, and economic services
            within poor rural communities. The components will: 1)
            finance small-scale subprojects generated by the
            communities, through the Fonds d'Intervention pour le
            Developpement (FID), in a participatory rural appraisal
            process. Except for roads, and complex irrigation systems
            executed by the FID, investments will be executed by
            community associations, whose capacity will be strengthened
            through training provision. Those communes, selected based
            on poverty indicators, will be improved through community
            mobilization, and consultation processes, to be able to
            identify specific investments, and contribute as well, a
            percentage of its costs, in materials, labor, and money.
            Financing of consulting services will be provided for
            technical aspects of the investment, and training will
            ensure the adequacy of the investment cycle; 2) support
            capacity building activities for local government officials,
            and personnel of commune governments. Training in community
            participation, mobilization, and in drafting communal
            development plans will be provided, in addition to
            accounting, fiscal budgeting, and procurement training; 3)
            transfer funds to communes for financing activities in their
            communal development plans, with full powers over project
            execution to commune governments; and, 4) finance the
            operation of the FID entity, which will be responsible for
            overseeing the implementation of activities financed by the project.
